homeExemptions.postDeathTreatment: subject to recovery only if part of probate estate and no protected heirs remain

recoveryTimeframes.statuteLimit: 6 months from executor qualification or within 1 year of death

criteria: loss of essential housing or support

incomeDisregards: incurred medical expenses can reduce countable income

spousalProtections.jointPropertyTreatment: not subject to recovery if it avoids probate
additionalProtections: no recovery from estate of surviving spouse

administrative.agency: Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services (DMAS), Estate Recovery Unit

programEffectiveness.estatesPursued: probate estates with real property or liquid assets

effectiveStrategies: use revocable trusts, joint tenancy, and TOD deeds to avoid probate
use spend-down planning with medical expenses to qualify
submit timely hardship waivers for qualified heirs
consult local probate laws for procedural compliance
